list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Updated config.yml default values.
The default settings are higher than previously. Moved teleport_y also.
Added worldguard support.
Clean up some code.

task.summary:
ðŸŒŸ Skyline Update â€“ Important Changes & New Features!
ðŸš¨ Dropped Support for Versions Below 1.20.1 If you are using Minecraft 1.16+, please stick with Skyline v2.1.5.
ðŸ”„ Major Changes & Enhancements:
New Animation System: Instead of using an invisible arrow, Skyline now uses ItemDisplay to represent the grappling hook, allowing it to display any supported item type. New Configuration Field:
settings: display_material: <material>
This lets you customize the material of the displayed item.
ðŸ› Improvements & Fixes:
Placement Restrictions: Skyline can no longer be placed if the selected material is a block. Consumption Prevention: If the selected material is a consumable, players wonâ€™t be able to eat or drink it. Particle Customization: Added configuration options for particle colors, size, and amount to enhance visual effects. Version Fix: The last update mistakenly caused a "new version available" message on startup due to an incorrect version number in plugin.yml. This has been fixed. updates JDK version back to Java 17
ðŸ“Œ Updating Your Config: To take advantage of these new features, please update your config.yml by referring to the latest version here: ðŸ‘‰ Skyline Config.yml
ðŸ”œ Next Update (Planned):
Adding support for newer materials beyond Minecraft 1.20.1, even if the API doesn't officially support them yet.
This makes the update clearer and more user-friendly. Let me know if you want any adjustments! ðŸ˜Š

MESSAGE.value:
Skyline Update â€“ Important Changes & New Features!
Dropped Support for Versions Below 1.20.1 If you are using Minecraft 1.16+, please stick with Skyline v2.1.5.
Major Changes & Enhancements:
New Animation System: Instead of using an invisible arrow, Skyline now uses ItemDisplay to represent the grappling hook, allowing it to display any supported item type. New Configuration Field:
settings: display_material: <material>
This lets you customize the material of the displayed item.
Improvements & Fixes:
Placement Restrictions: Skyline can no longer be placed if the selected material is a block. Consumption Prevention: If the selected material is a consumable, players wonâ€™t be able to eat or drink it. Particle Customization: Added configuration options for particle colors, size, and amount to enhance visual effects. Version Fix: The last update mistakenly caused a "new version available" message on startup due to an incorrect version number in plugin.yml. This has been fixed.
Updating Your Config: To take advantage of these new features, please update your config.yml by referring to the latest version here: Skyline Config.yml
Next Update (Planned):
Adding support for newer materials beyond Minecraft 1.20.1, even if the API doesn't officially support them yet.
This makes the update clearer and more user-friendly. Let me know if you want any adjustments!

Skyline Update â€“ Important Changes & New Features!
Dropped Support for Versions Below 1.20.1 If you are using Minecraft 1.16+, please stick with Skyline v2.1.5.
Major Changes & Enhancements:
New Animation System: Instead of using an invisible arrow, Skyline now uses ItemDisplay to represent the grappling hook, allowing it to display any supported item type. New Configuration Field:
settings: display_material: <material>
This lets you customize the material of the displayed item.
Improvements & Fixes:
Placement Restrictions: Skyline can no longer be placed if the selected material is a block. Consumption Prevention: If the selected material is a consumable, players wonâ€™t be able to eat or drink it. Particle Customization: Added configuration options for particle colors, size, and amount to enhance visual effects. Version Fix: The last update mistakenly caused a "new version available" message on startup due to an incorrect version number in plugin.yml. This has been fixed. updates JDK version back to Java 17
Updating Your Config: To take advantage of these new features, please update your config.yml by referring to the latest version here: Skyline Config.yml
Next Update (Planned):
Adding support for newer materials beyond Minecraft 1.20.1, even if the API doesn't officially support them yet.
This makes the update clearer and more user-friendly. Let me know if you want any adjustments!
